title: N.H. woman arrested for alleged murder of her baby following 11-month investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hepay Juma, 26, was arrested for reckless second-degree murder after an 11-month investigation into her infant's death.
The infant, referred to as 'Baby Jane Doe', was found in Pine Island Pond, Manchester, N.H. on March 27, 2025.
New Hampshire Attorney General John Formella cited 'extreme indifference to human life' as a reason for the murder charge.

title: Way overdue on checking a carâ€™s transmission fluid
author: John Paul
bullets: A 2006 Mazda3 owner had black transmission fluid; mechanic suggests a drain and refill, not a flush, for now.
A 2019 Subaru Crosstrek needs tire sensor replacements and control arm bushing work, estimated at $1,600 by a dealer.
A 2018 GMC Denali owner questioned antifreeze levels; expert suggests topping off and periodic checks for potential leaks.

title: South Shore school evacuated after snow causes ‘structural stress’ on roof
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Plymouth River School in Hingham was evacuated due to roof stress from heavy snow accumulation.
Students were relocated to Hingham High School for safety precautions and completed the school day there.
Hingham received over 17 inches of snow, prompting concerns about the school's roof stability.

title: David Ortiz changes his tune on Rafael Devers after previous criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Ortiz previously criticized Rafael Devers for poor defense and fitness, leading to Devers' trade to the Giants.
Ortiz now expresses love and respect for Devers, emphasizing their long relationship and Devers' growth as a player.
Devers was traded after refusing to switch positions, despite the Red Sox's needs following a key injury.

title: Gas leak identified as cause of Taunton explosion that displaced 8 residents
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A gas leak caused an explosion and fire at a Taunton home, seriously injuring a woman and her daughter.
The blast destroyed the home at 78 Plain St., displaced eight residents, and damaged two nearby houses.
Community fundraisers have raised over $33,000 for the injured family and additional funds for other residents affected.

title: Patriots reportedly remain a bottom-10 team in new NFLPA report card
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots ranked 26th out of 32 NFL teams in the 2026 NFLPA report card, up from 31st in 2025.
Team travel resources, especially the team plane, received the lowest rating, affecting overall grades.
New facility expected for 2026 aims to improve poor scores for weight, training rooms, and practice fields.

title: Malden teacher, basketball coach arraigned amid allegations he raped high school foster child
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Malden teacher Scott Marino arraigned on charges of raping an 18-year-old foster child in his care.
Marino allegedly supplied alcohol to the victim and assaulted her on February 18 during school vacation.
Marino was released on $75,000 bail with GPS monitoring and is due back in court on April 16.

title: State Police sergeant charged with assaulting driver during traffic stop
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Sergeant Joel Daoust is charged with assault after a traffic stop in Springfield in January, prosecutors announced.
Daoust allegedly used physical force and pepper spray on a driver pulled over for speeding and lane violations.
State Police relieved Daoust of duty, citing previous disciplinary actions in 2015 and 2017.

title: Readers push back on ChatGPT use in Massachusetts executive branch
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts will be the first state to implement ChatGPT AI in the executive branch, affecting 40,000 employees.
65% of surveyed Massachusetts readers oppose Gov. Maura Healey's AI rollout, citing security, privacy, and environmental concerns.
Supporters argue that AI can improve productivity and efficiency, with secure measures to protect data privacy in place.

title: What a traveling nurse experienced on the hard-hit Cape after Monday’s blizzard
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Traveling nurse Colleen Wright navigated unplowed roads and downed wires on Cape Cod to reach elderly clients post-blizzard.
The blizzard left nearly 160,000 residents without power; less than 50,000 remained affected by Thursday, Eversource reported.
Four shelters in Provincetown, Harwich, Mashpee, and Barnstable housed 200 elderly people during ongoing power restoration efforts.
